metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition
metadata.notes: Values extracted from Division B, Part 9. All dimensions verified against source PDF text.

articles.title: General
articles.full_text: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, handrails and guards.

articles.title: Stair Width
articles.full_text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm.

requirements.description: Exit stairs and public stairs for residential occupancy
requirements.exact_quote: required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm

requirements.description: Exit stairs for single dwelling unit or house with secondary suite
requirements.exact_quote: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm

requirements.description: Exit stairs for non-residential occupancy - minimum width
requirements.exact_quote: required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of a) 900 mm

requirements.description: Exit stairs for non-residential - per person calculation
requirements.formula: 8 mm per person based on occupant load (Table 3.1.17.1)
requirements.exact_quote: 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1

requirements.description: Interior stairs within dwelling unit and exterior stairs (not exit)
requirements.exact_quote: at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit, and exterior stairs serving a single dwelling unit except required exit stairs, shall have a width of not less than 860 mm

articles.title: Height over Stairs
articles.full_text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above.

requirements.description: Clear height over stairs - general
requirements.exact_quote: the clear height over stairs shall not be less than 2050 mm

requirements.description: Clear height over stairs - single dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: the clear height over stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall not be less than 1950 mm

requirements.description: Clear height over stairs - under beams/ducting in secondary suites
requirements.exact_quote: The clear height over stairs that are located under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall not be less than 1850 mm

requirements.description: Minimum risers in interior flights (except dwelling units)
requirements.exact_quote: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights

requirements.description: Maximum vertical height of any flight
requirements.exact_quote: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m

articles.title: Dimensions for Risers
articles.full_text: The rise, which is measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall comply with Table 9.8.4.1.

requirements.description: Rise for private stairs (single dwelling, house with secondary suite, their garages)
requirements.exact_quote: Private stairs - Rise Max 200mm, Min 125mm

requirements.description: Rise for public stairs (all stairs not private or service)
requirements.exact_quote: Public stairs - Rise Max 180mm, Min 125mm

requirements.description: Run for rectangular treads - private stairs
requirements.exact_quote: Private stairs - Run Max 355mm, Min 255mm

requirements.description: Run for rectangular treads - public stairs
requirements.exact_quote: Public stairs - Run No limit (max), Min 280mm

requirements.description: Tread depth relative to run
requirements.exact_quote: The depth of a rectangular tread shall be not less than its run and not more than its run plus 25 mm

requirements.description: Run at narrow end of tapered tread
requirements.exact_quote: tapered treads shall have a run that is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread

requirements.description: Run measured at 300mm from handrail centerline
requirements.exact_quote: complies with the dimensions stated in Table 9.8.4.2. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centreline of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread

articles.title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads

requirements.description: Maximum tolerance between adjacent risers
requirements.exact_quote: risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings

requirements.description: Maximum tolerance between tallest and shortest risers in flight
requirements.exact_quote: 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight

requirements.description: Maximum tolerance between adjacent treads
requirements.exact_quote: Rectangular treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads

requirements.description: Maximum tolerance between deepest and shallowest treads
requirements.exact_quote: 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight

requirements.description: Maximum slope of treads
requirements.exact_quote: The slope of treads shall not exceed 1 in 50

requirements.description: Individual winder tread turn angle
requirements.exact_quote: Individual treads in winders that converge on a centre point shall turn through an angle of a) 30 degrees with no deviation, or b) 45 degrees with no deviation

requirements.description: Maximum turn per set of winders
requirements.exact_quote: Where winders are incorporated into a stair, each set shall not turn through more than 90 degrees

requirements.description: Outer handrail height for spiral stairs
requirements.exact_quote: handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1070 mm high

requirements.description: Clear width between handrails for spiral stairs
requirements.exact_quote: a clear width not less than 660 mm between the handrails

requirements.description: Maximum riser height for spiral stairs
requirements.exact_quote: risers that are not more than 240 mm high

requirements.description: Minimum tread depth at 300mm from handrail
requirements.exact_quote: treads that are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centreline of the handrails at the narrower edge

requirements.description: Minimum clear height for spiral stairs
requirements.exact_quote: not less than 1980 mm clear height

requirements.description: Spiral stairs as only egress - occupant limit
requirements.exact_quote: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence (1) are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons

requirements.description: Spiral stairs cannot serve as exit
requirements.exact_quote: Spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit

requirements.description: Rounded or beveled edge extension
requirements.exact_quote: the top of the nosings of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 14 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing

requirements.description: Minimum nosing edge with resilient material
requirements.exact_quote: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum extension of the rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm

requirements.description: Minimum ramp width - general
requirements.exact_quote: ramps shall be not less than 1100 mm wide

requirements.description: Minimum ramp width - single dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide

requirements.description: Clear height over ramps - general
requirements.exact_quote: the clear height over ramps shall be not less than 2050 mm

requirements.description: Clear height over ramps - single dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1950 mm

requirements.description: Maximum slope for exterior ramps
requirements.exact_quote: 1 in 10 for exterior ramps

requirements.description: Maximum slope for interior ramps - residential
requirements.exact_quote: 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies

requirements.description: Maximum slope for industrial occupancies
requirements.exact_quote: 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies

requirements.description: Maximum slope for all other occupancies
requirements.exact_quote: 1 in 8 for all other occupancies

requirements.description: Maximum rise between floors/landings when slope > 1:12
requirements.exact_quote: Where the slope of the ramp is greater than 1 in 12, the maximum rise between floors or landings shall be 1500 mm

requirements.description: Landings as wide and long as stair/ramp width
requirements.exact_quote: landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur

requirements.description: Landing length for non-turning or <90 degree turn
requirements.exact_quote: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90 degrees, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of a) the required width of the stair or ramp, or b) 1100 mm

requirements.description: Maximum landing slope
requirements.exact_quote: The slope of landings shall not exceed 1 in 50

requirements.description: Clear height over landings - general
requirements.exact_quote: the clear height over landings shall be not less than 2050 mm

requirements.description: Clear height over landings - single dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1950 mm

requirements.description: Required handrail height range
requirements.exact_quote: required handrails shall be 865 mm to 1070 mm high

requirements.description: Clearance between handrail and smooth surface
requirements.exact_quote: The clearance between a handrail and the surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm

requirements.description: Clearance between handrail and rough/abrasive surface
requirements.exact_quote: where said surface is rough or abrasive, 60 mm

requirements.description: Maximum handrail projection into required width
requirements.exact_quote: Handrails and constructions below handrails, including handrail supports and stair stringers, shall not project more than 100 mm into the required width of a stair or ramp

requirements.description: Horizontal extension beyond top and bottom of flight
requirements.exact_quote: at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp
exceptions: stairs serving only one dwelling unit

requirements.description: Concentrated load resistance for all handrails
requirements.exact_quote: a concentrated load of not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails

requirements.description: Uniform load resistance for handrails not in single dwelling
requirements.exact_quote: for handrails other than those serving a single dwelling unit, a uniform load of not less than 0.7 kN/m

requirements.description: Maximum attachment point spacing
requirements.exact_quote: the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane

requirements.description: Maximum distance from handrail end to first attachment
requirements.exact_quote: the first attachment point at either end is located no more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail

requirements.description: Minimum screw penetration into solid wood
requirements.exact_quote: the fasteners consist of not less than 2 No.8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood

requirements.description: Elevation difference requiring guard
requirements.exact_quote: shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length where the difference in elevation is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface within 1.2 m

requirements.description: Minimum guard height - general
requirements.exact_quote: all guards shall be not less than 1070 mm high

requirements.description: Minimum guard height - within dwelling units
requirements.exact_quote: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high

requirements.description: Exterior guards for single dwelling when walking surface <=1800mm above ground
requirements.condition: walking surface not more than 1800 mm above finished ground level
requirements.exact_quote: Exterior guards serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1800 mm above the finished ground level

requirements.description: Maximum opening size in guards
requirements.exact_quote: openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm

requirements.description: Maximum triangular opening at stairs
requirements.exact_quote: the triangular openings formed by stair risers, stair treads and the bottom element of a required guard shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a 150 mm diam sphere

requirements.description: Maximum opening size for industrial guards
requirements.exact_quote: guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm

articles.title: Design of Guards to Not Facilitate Climbing

requirements.description: Anti-climbing zone on guards protecting level >4.2m
requirements.condition: level more than 4.2 m above adjacent level
requirements.exact_quote: guards required by Article 9.8.8.1. that protect a level located more than 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing

requirements.description: Specified load for stairs serving single dwelling
requirements.exact_quote: 1.9 kPa for stairs and ramps serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces

requirements.description: Specified load for other stairs
requirements.exact_quote: 4.8 kPa for other stairs and ramps

requirements.description: Minimum effective depth of stringers
requirements.measurement: perpendicular to bottom at point of minimum cross-section
requirements.exact_quote: have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section

requirements.description: Minimum overall depth of stringers
requirements.exact_quote: an overall depth of not less than 235 mm

requirements.description: Minimum thickness if supported along length
requirements.exact_quote: be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length

requirements.description: Minimum thickness if unsupported along length
requirements.exact_quote: 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length

requirements.description: Maximum stringer spacing for single dwelling
requirements.exact_quote: be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. in stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite

requirements.description: Maximum stringer spacing for other stairs
requirements.exact_quote: 600 mm o.c. in other stairs

requirements.description: Minimum tread thickness in dwelling units
requirements.exact_quote: Stair treads of lumber, plywood or OSB within dwelling units shall be not less than 25 mm actual thickness

requirements.description: Minimum tread thickness with open risers when span > 750mm
requirements.condition: open risers permitted and distance between stringers exceeds 750 mm
requirements.exact_quote: where open risers are permitted and the distance between stringers exceeds 750 mm, the treads shall be not less than 38 mm actual thickness
